title: Why does IE not have an extension design for web developer easily?
body:
Previously on IE extension.
I have an extension design for IE.
(here is the link: http://studiobinghuan.blogspot.tw/2013/11/ie-extension-helper.html)
Why does Microsoft not just have one for this?
It might be easy to have a extension for web developer.
What I mention is this: http://studiobinghuan.blogspot.tw/2013/11/ie-extension-helper.html
“IE Extension Helper”.
It’s similar to the skeleton of chrome extension.
This is an extension builder for web developer to generate a Microsoft Internet extension easily.
Usually, web developer might be not familiar with C++/C or C# programming languages.
After checking the chrome, Firefox and safari extension framework, they also provide the convenient way to let developer to develop browser extension by using HTML5 technology. Let web developer not be afraid to build up a browser extension. It’s because they can use the original web development skill to make one extension.
But in Microsoft Internet Explorer, Microsoft does not provide the extension framework for web developer to build up a extension easily. So, I just create one to let web developer build an extension easily.
I wonder to know, why does Microsoft not just have this one to build IE Extension easily
